sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}, and let C = {1, 2, 3}. Find the value of ((A × B) ∆ C) and (A × (B ∆ C)) and determine whether the Cartesian product of two sets is associative with respect to symmetric difference based on your calculations.
